The chances of getting the order for Great Britain may be prejudiced if a decision is not taken very rapidly, and I propose therefore to issue the licence as requested unless any of my colleagues take objection before Saturday, May 28th.In accordance with the Cabinet Decision of the 25th November, 1925, (Cab. 54/25) I propose that this long term licence when issued shall not contain the usual condition that it may be modified or revoked at any time by the Board of Trade without reason given, and that Nobel Industries, Limited, shall be informed that it will not be withdrawn "save in the event of circumstances of an altogether exceptional character arising which the Board are at present quite unable to foresee".P.C-L.Board of Trade, 25th May, 1927.-8-
